subject: Re: Can I please get a reply
description_text:
Not really. I got a response, id was i was instructed and they are now
'dead'. Im very upset. I couldn't even sleep last night

On Fri, Sep 26, 2025, 8:32 PM SJ Perkins <thatoneracerguysj@gmail.com>
wrote:

>
> On Fri, Sep 26, 2025, 8:30 PM support@simsonn.com

Hi SJ Perkins,     Please first uninstall SIMSONN Manager 2.1.0 from your computer, and then download and install the 2.1.1 version using the provided link.  Once the installation is complete, go to: Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → Select the file pedals-firmware-pedals-proxultra.sfu  After the firmware update is finished, check if the device connects properly. Next, open the Vibration Test interface to test the vibration function, making sure to select the correct motor type. We also recommend updating the telemetry data to ensure everything works correctly.      https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BAdSWa1bxmbPksj9Hlzuo8bl7_bM8ixr/view?usp=sharing

Ok, they updated, now my lights dont work!! Im getting very upset right now

Update: I revert to older firmware. Led's came back on. Vibration worked
well for 2 runs. Then upon exiting the game to try a different track, the
throttle pedal just 'low rumbles'. Constantly. Nothing from brakes. I tried
playing again, no output to the vams.

This -has to be- a firmware issue!!

ID 号为 4170 和 4277 的工单已合并到此工单。

合并来自工单4170  
      主题: Vam help  
      描述:  My VAMs are being odd. I hooked them up, changed a couple settings so it would vibrate with engine rpms and speed, and feel the lockup on the brakes. But as soon as I fire up iracing they just vibrate one speed, one tone, no increase with rpm, no brake shake with lockup. The throttle was just one note, solid. It wouldn't quit even when I exited the program. I had to unplug it to make it stop. Now it says power disconnected but its not. Any ideas??

合并来自工单4277  
      主题: Can I please get a reply  
      描述:  I did all updates as instructed. Now the vams dont turn on , and my LEDs shut off!! ?

Hi SJ Perkins,  ​Are you using the ProX Ultra pedals? It seems we may have sent you the wrong firmware version last time. Please avoid using a USB hub and instead connect the control box directly to the USB 3.0 blue port on the back of your PC. If the clutch motor vibration feels weaker than expected, you can swap the clutch and brake motor cables to test if the motor itself is working correctly. We will soon release a firmware update to address the issue of unstable vibration strength on the clutch port. In the meantime, you can always revert to the previous firmware version if needed.

Yes, they are the pro-x ultra. I have no clutch pedal. The vam motor is had
in the throttle pedal is already fried. It is burnt, I can smell it, and is
quite weak. I replaced it with thr 3rd(spare). I would expect some type of
warranty coverage on said unit?
So what do I do now? Which firmware do I use? I would really like them to
work. I literally lost sleep over it, I was that upset about it.
Can I get a refund? A replacement? A firmware update? Something?

On Wed, Oct 1, 2025, 2:56 AM service@simsonn.com

I dont use a USB hub everyone seems to use. They are plugged in directly to
the blue 3.0 ports, yes

Hi SJ Perkins,    Please don’t worry — we’ve optimized the algorithm, and the update will be available to you within the next couple of days. The new version makes the VAM more powerful while ensuring the motor won’t be damaged. For any units that are already damaged, we’ll send you replacements free of charge.

Thank you! (Is there any way i can just get the vam pro as a replacement??
I should have gotten those to begin with)

Address for replacement is

SJ Perkins
4185 nw Walnut Pl
Corvallis, OR 97330 USA

On Wed, Oct 1, 2025, 7:33 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi SJ Perkins,    I can send you a VAM Pro as a replacement. Since it’s the National Holiday in China from October 1st to 8th, we’ll ship it to you around October 9th.

A 2 pack?? One would be silly but I'll take it!! Thank you!

Look forward to seeing it,  and the updated firmware

On Wed, Oct 1, 2025, 7:43 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi SJ Perkins,    I will send you one VAM and one VAM Pro. Could you confirm if both of your units are damaged? Please note that the cost of the VAM Pro is quite high — we are mainly providing it to ensure you have the best experience, rather than to make much profit from these two devices.

I honestly dont know, as they're  acting so irradicly. One is for sure
fried, I can smell it. I dont want to even turn them on again till I get
the updated firmware; I'm afraid of damaging the other 2. And thank you
again for your help

On Wed, Oct 1, 2025, 7:49 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi SJ Perkins,    Alright, it should be ready within the next couple of days. Please wait for my updated file. I’ll also be testing it during my off hours, and once I confirm everything works properly, I’ll send it to you right away.

That is most amazing of you. Thank you again! I will even make a review
video and post it on all the social media platforms for being such a
stand-up company/ person.

On Wed, Oct 1, 2025, 7:58 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi SJ Perkins,    Thank you for your support! We will continue to develop more products, including wheel bases and steering wheels, to provide everyone with a better experience and service.

Any firmware update to share?

again. I tried to revert to the old firmware, but it won't work this time.

file/folder. Is the controller box bad perhaps?

Hi SJ Perkins,     Please uninstall the old version from your computer, then reinstall version 2.1.2 and update the firmware. After the update, the device version should display as CPU1: 2.0.5, CPU2: 2.0.3. If the issue still persists, please feel free to contact me.   ​https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PZwHUqhhmJw0IBGDO8mGONPbrICJU3z1/view?usp=drive_link

The system will automatically prompt if a new version is available — simply click Update Firmware. If the software version appears incorrect, please send me a screenshot so I can confirm. The process is very simple, and there’s no need for remote assistance. It’s 12:28 AM here, so I’ll be heading to rest soon. If you encounter any issues during testing, we can continue our discussion tomorrow.

Hi SJ Perkins,  Please remember to release the upgrade button on the control box, otherwise the device will enter recovery mode the next time it’s powered on. Here is the telemetry support list. The device also supports SimHub version 9.9.3 and above, but please note that SimHub and Simsonn Manager cannot run at the same time, as this will cause conflicts.

Hi SJ Perkins,    That’s impossible. Please open ToDesk so I can check the situation remotely.

Hi SJ Perkins,    Is your USB cable connected directly to the blue USB 3.0 port on the back of your computer? Please avoid using a USB hub, as it can cause unstable power supply and frequent disconnections.

Hi SJ Perkins,  It’s also possible that your VAM may be damaged or short-circuited. Under normal conditions, you can simply run multiple tests in the vibration interface to easily determine whether it’s functioning properly.

Ok, hold on. Ill be on in a minute. But they are extremely powerful. Too
much. I liked how they were before. (When they worked)

On Sun, Oct 5, 2025, 9:38 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi SJ Perkins,    The vibration intensity range of the VAM is intentionally limited, and its frequency cannot be adjusted — that’s by design. Fanatec’s vibration works in a similar way and also doesn’t allow intensity adjustment.

Hi SJ Perkins,     Your VAM device cannot operate in VAM Pro mode.  The Simagic and Fanatec vibration motors you mentioned produce almost the same effect, with very strong vibration.  I recommend adding rubber pads to the mounting bracket — this can effectively reduce resonance noise.

got them!!

Found this on the iracing help pages. I know, not the same brand, but let's
be honest here, its basically the same thing.

Simagic Alpha Wheelbase and Haptic Pedal Reactor:
We are currently investigating performance issues related to the Simagic
Alpha Series wheelbases and Simagic Haptic Pedal Reactor.

Users have reported performance issues when using the Alpha series
wheelbases in 360Hz mode and when using the Haptic Pedal Reactor, these
issues seem to be related with the high polling rate of these features
causing USB bus flooding (see USB Issues for more info).

360Hz for Alpha series wheelbases can be disabled by setting the line
"loadSimagicAPI=0" in Documents/iRacing/app.ini.

Haptic Pedal Reactor functionality can be disabled by unchecking "vibrate
pedals" in the Option Menu after launching iRacing.

> Simagic Alpha Wheelbase and Haptic Pedal Reactor:
> We are currently investigating performance issues related to the Simagic
> Alpha Series wheelbases and Simagic Haptic Pedal Reactor.
>
> Users have reported performance issues when using the Alpha series
> wheelbases in 360Hz mode and when using the Haptic Pedal Reactor, these
> issues seem to be related with the high polling rate of these features
> causing USB bus flooding (see USB Issues for more info).
>
> 360Hz for Alpha series wheelbases can be disabled by setting the line
> "loadSimagicAPI=0" in Documents/iRacing/app.ini.
>
> Haptic Pedal Reactor functionality can be disabled by unchecking "vibrate
> pedals" in the Option Menu after launching iRacing.
